meanings.definition: A person or thing that augments or increases something.
meanings.sent1: The talented artist was an augmentor of beauty in the community.
meanings.sent2: The new technology acted as an augmentor for productivity in the office.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog became an augmentor of joy in the family's home.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude served as an augmentor, lifting the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The sunshine was like an augmentor, brightening up the entire room.

meanings.definition: A device that increases the thrust of a jet engine.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic carefully installed the augmentor to boost the jet engine's power.
meanings.sent2: Pilots rely on the augmentor to enhance the performance of the aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The sleek design of the augmentor made it look like a futuristic gadget.
meanings.sent4: The augmentor roared to life, propelling the plane forward with incredible force.
meanings.sent5: The augmentor hummed softly, indicating its readiness for takeoff.

meanings.definition: To make something greater by adding to it.
meanings.sent1: She decided to augment her collection by adding rare coins to it.
meanings.sent2: The chef used special spices to augment the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to augment the conversation with jokes only made it more awkward.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouragement augmented the students' confidence in their abilities.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations augmented the festive atmosphere of the party.
